intro: Coccyganthe pratensis, commonly known as the meadow coccyganthe, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming from late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
